Product & Platform Leader

Product & Platform Leader

I bring 20+ years’ experience across product, design, and delivery, with deep experience in healthcare and life sciences.

I’m strong at balancing evolving requirements, decision-making, and execution, with a focus on measurable outcomes.

I operate at the crossover between subject matter experts, software engineers, and users, translating messy real-world user journeys into coherent, scalable products.

My work typically involves a combination of:

Product Management UX and UI Design Service Design User Research Digital Strategy Content Design & Information Architecture

This expertise means I’m highly effective at defining, delivering, and evolving products that meet real user needs and achieve business goals.

Selected Contract Roles

Role: Product Lead – AI-Enabled Scientific Platforms

Client: Recursion (formerly Exscientia)

Project: Chemist Platform

(Background: Recursion is a biotech company focused on accelerating drug discovery by combining machine learning with large-scale automated laboratory experimentation).

Summary of work

I led product definition for Chemist, a scientific platform used internally to support AI-assisted reasoning, decision-making, and experimental planning.

The work focused on two complementary strands of work:

Firstly, designing interfaces to keep humans-in-the-loop for specialist tools, allowing medicinal chemists to interrogate and guide complex AI outputs and scientific data.

Secondly, stitching multiple tools into a coherent workflow that enabled seamless movement from hypothesis exploration through to experimental planning.

Key achievements

  • Improved scientific decision-making by redesigning tools used for hypothesis evaluation, compound exploration, and experimental planning.
  • Increased findability and UX for expert users by re-architecting information structures and navigation surfaces.
  • Created shared design and interaction patterns across Chemist and adjacent scientific platforms, enabling more consistent and scalable product growth.
  • Demonstrated the value of product design and user testing by using evidence to shape decisions before build.

Role: Product / Platform Lead – Digital Transformation

Client: CVS Group plc

Project: Veterinary Digital Platforms (CVS & Animed)

(Background: CVS Group is a large veterinary services provider operating across the UK, with multiple consumer-facing brands and a growing focus on digital transformation and regulatory transparency).

Summary of work

I led product and experience design across CVS’s core veterinary platform and its e-commerce brand, Animed, shaping key customer-facing journeys within a wider digital transformation programme.

The work focused on re-architecting critical flows to bridge legacy systems and new vendor tooling, while balancing usability, compliance, brand coherence, and future platform direction in a highly regulated environment.

Key achievements

  • Defined and re-architected critical customer and practice journeys to support a multi-year digital transformation across CVS brands.
  • Improved booking and appointment journeys around a newly introduced third-party provider, materially improving usability despite platform constraints.
  • Set the early direction for personalisation across CVS and Animed, identifying how shared data could be incrementally captured and used across fragmented brands and systems.
  • Acted as the connective layer between brand, UX, technical delivery, and vendors, preventing misalignment between intent and implementation.

Role: Product / Journey Lead – Trading & Transfers

Client: Lloyds Banking Group

Project: Stockbroking Mobile App (Pre-launch)

(Background: Lloyds Banking Group operates in a highly regulated environment with complex legacy systems and significant compliance obligations, particularly in trading and investment products).

Summary of work

I led the definition and orchestration of two “hero” journeys—trading and transfers—for Lloyds’ next-generation stockbroking app, operating across a partially migrated technical landscape.

The work focused on turning a fragmented and ambiguous set of requirements into clear, testable end-to-end journeys, aligning customer needs, decision logic, and system constraints so the work could progress safely into delivery.

Key achievements

  • Clarified complex trading and transfer journeys by producing clear wireframes and journey artefacts that captured decision logic and asset- and location-specific constraints.
  • Extended the design system with new patterns and components, enabling complex journeys while maintaining consistency across the wider product.
  • Enabled the project to hit aggressive deadlines by aligning senior stakeholders in a highly ambiguous, politically complex environment.
  • Improved journey performance and decision logic by validating assumptions through prototyping and user research before delivery.

Role: Product Lead – Behavioural Health Platform

Client: Sidekick Health

Project: Digital Therapeutics Application

(Background: Sidekick Health is a digital health and therapeutics company operating across multiple global markets and focussing on users living with chronic health conditions).

Summary of work

I initiated an object-oriented UX (OOUX) approach to bring coherence to a product team that lacked a shared understanding, defining the product’s core objects, their attributes, and relationships.

I then focused on optimising conversion for the critical on-boarding journey once the OOUX work was complete.

Key achievements

  • Improved early engagement and trust by redesigning and testing onboarding and activation journeys for users with complex health needs.
  • Created a coherent behavioural model by simplifying fragmented product mechanics and aligning them to long-term outcomes.
  • Established an Object-Oriented UX (OOUX) foundation that enabled consistent design, experimentation, and iteration.
  • Implemented a scalable information architecture that supported platform growth, analytics, and future intelligent guidance.
  • Enabled clearer, safer product decisions by translating clinical and behavioural intent into structures teams could ship and govern.

Role: Product and Design Systems Lead

Client: University of Liverpool

Project: University of Liverpool Website

(Background: One of the original red-brick universities, the University of Liverpool operates a highly decentralised digital estate, with hundreds of departments contributing to over 100,000 pages).

Summary of work

I led a design system–led overhaul of the university’s digital platform, aligning interaction patterns, content design, information architecture, and governance across a fragmented digital estate.

The aim was to bring coherence, scalability, and long-term maintainability to a fragmented estate without centralising control away from departments.

Key achievements

  • Established a university-wide design system that aligned visual design, content standards, and information architecture across a fragmented digital estate.
  • Re-architected information architecture across 100k+ pages, introducing clear hierarchies, naming conventions, and governance models.
  • Enabled consistent, scalable delivery by creating reusable components, patterns, content templates, and practical documentation.
  • Aligned technical, design, and content teams around shared constraints and standards, improving adoption and long-term resilience.

Role: Product Design Lead

Client: AstraZeneca

Project: Global Portfolio Resource Management

(Background: AstraZeneca is a global biopharmaceutical company operating at scale, with complex portfolio, funding, and delivery decisions spanning multiple scientific and operational disciplines).

Summary of work

I was product design lead for a global internal decision platform, working with senior stakeholders to shape how portfolio planning and resource allocation decisions were made across the organisation.

The platform operated across complex organisational, financial, and delivery constraints, with significant downstream impact on investment, funding, and prioritisation decisions.

Key achievements

  • Defined a system-level solution that aligned portfolio and resource decision-making across five global (vertical) business units and multiple (horizontal) functions with competing priorities.
  • Created clear, usable product capabilities from complex organisational rules, dependencies, and constraints.
  • Saved time and cost by evaluating and reusing existing internal tools and initiatives where they available
  • Reduced risk and increased buy in by using a high-fidelity prototype to test feasibility, value, and trade-offs.
  • Enabled executive decision-making under uncertainty by producing phased roadmaps and a supporting business case.

Role: Principal Digital Consultant – Platforms & Design Operations

Client: Nexer Digital

Project: Misc

(Background: Nexer Digital is a 100+ person digital consultancy providing Service and Product Design solutions as part of the global Nexer Group).

Summary of work

I worked with leadership to explore how design systems and design operations could reduce duplication, improve consistency, and scale delivery as the organisation grew.

The focus was on treating internal ways of working as products, not process, and making system-level thinking practical for teams.

Key achievements

  • Defined a reusable platform approach to delivery, enabling teams to scale client work without rebuilding foundations each time.
  • Reduced duplication and improved consistency by introducing modularisation and inheritance across design and delivery practices.
  • Set a shared direction for evolving internal standards, tooling, and practices through a clear, adoptable roadmap.

Role: Product Design Principal

Client: Convatec

Project: Amcare Redesign

(Background: Convatec is a FTSE 100 healthcare company specialising in wound, continence, and stoma care. Amcare is a Convatec service, providing nationwide home health support for people living with complex, long-term conditions).

Summary of work

I led the end-to-end redesign and relaunch of the Amcare website, covering discovery, content, and product design. The work involved navigating a complex internal landscape while delivering a clearer, more usable service for users managing sensitive health needs.

Key achievements

  • Redesigned and relaunched the Amcare website (circa 50 pages) within a three-month window.
  • Delivered the project on time and on budget despite technical and organisational constraints.
  • Improved clarity and usability for users accessing home health services for complex conditions.
  • Successfully navigated internal technical and political complexity to keep delivery moving.

Role: Principal Digital Consultant

Client: Sciris Group

Project: Digital Team Migration

(Background: Sciris Group is an international network of healthcare agencies supporting global pharmaceutical clients, operating across multiple platforms, suppliers, and delivery teams).

Summary of work

I led a complex digital capability transition across the group, rationalising platforms, suppliers, and delivery ownership while maintaining continuity for live client work.

The focus was on reducing risk, protecting revenue, and creating clearer accountability across a fragmented provider network.

Key achievements

  • Migrated more than 50 active digital initiatives to alternative suppliers without disrupting live client delivery or damaging client relationships.
  • Clarified delivery ownership and platform responsibility across a fragmented, multi-agency network.
  • Improved efficiency and resilience during organisational change by restructuring processes and resourcing.
